intro: Matisia victoriana, commonly known as the yellow matisia, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary and secondary forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
